name: Spotify Connect
description: Use Gladys to Control your Spotify Premium account with Spotify Connect
instructionsHTML:
I recommend you use this link

Requirements

Have a Spotify Premium account

Spotify App

Clic on this link and log into the developer space

  1. Create a Spotify App
    On your developer space, clic on the button « create an app » and follow the instruction.
  2. Set the Redirect URI
    Then add your Redirect URI including your RasberryPi address. You can follow this example : https://<your—rpi-ip>/spotify
    DON’T FORGET TO SAVE YOUR CONFIGURATION !

    Installation

    Click on install button
    You don’t need to restart.

Settings

Clic on this link in your app to join your app and find your ID.
Again from your Gladys interface, go to the « Settings » view, then clic on the « Settings » tab.
Fill the settings with the following information :
spotify_client_id
spotify_client_secret
spotify_redirect_uri
Finally restart Gladys

4. Initialization of the module

Clic on the « Modules » view and on the button « Set »
After clicking on the button « set » you will receive a notification with a link :
Allow your Spotify Account by click on this url :
And follow the instruction.
If you didn’t receive this notif, check your Gladys’ logs by using the SSH method.
Congratulation your Gladys are configured !
You can test if everything works properly in the « Scripts » view.

Transform your RPI into a Spotify Connect Box

Connect any RPI device and execute this command :

instructionsMarkDown:
_I recommend you use this [link](https://github.com/AdrienDesola/gladys-spotify)_

# Requirements
Have a Spotify Premium account

# Spotify App
Clic on this [link](https://developer.spotify.com) and log into the developer space
1. Create a Spotify App
On your [developer space](https://developer.spotify.com/my-applications/#!/applications), clic on the button « create an app » and follow the instruction.
2. Set the Redirect URI
Then add your Redirect URI including your RasberryPi address. You can follow this example : https://<your—rpi-ip>/spotify
*DON’T FORGET TO SAVE YOUR CONFIGURATION !*
# Installation
Click on *install* button
You don’t need to restart.

# Settings
Clic on this [link](https://developer.spotify.com/my-applications) in your app to join your app and find your ID.
Again from your Gladys interface, go to the « Settings » view, then clic on the « Settings » tab.
Fill the settings with the following information :
spotify_client_id
spotify_client_secret
spotify_redirect_uri
*Finally restart Gladys*

## 4. Initialization of the module
Clic on the « Modules » view and on the button « Set »
After clicking on the button « set » you will receive a notification with a link :
*_Allow your Spotify Account by click on this url :_*
And follow the instruction.
If you didn’t receive this notif, check your Gladys’ logs by using the SSH method.
*Congratulation your Gladys are configured !*
You can test if everything works properly in the « Scripts » view.
```
gladys.music.playPlaylist('spotify:album:4ydl8Ci7OsndhI2ALnrpIv')
```
# Transform your RPI into a Spotify Connect Box
Connect any RPI device and execute this command :
```
curl -sL https://dtcooper.github.io/raspotify/install.sh | sh
```
As the author would say :
[quote, Raspotify author, raspotify doc]
*Spotify Connect client for the Raspberry Pi that Just Works™.*
[For more information about Raspotify](https://dtcooper.github.io/raspotify/)
